0.title: MARC-WSU Program Application Form
0.description: Application form for students to utilize in joining the MARC – WSU program.

fields.label: Personal Section Eligibility Reminder
fields.content:
Reminder: The MARC-WSU program will begin the week prior to classes starting in the fall semester and continue for two academic years. The program includes the summer between your third and final semester. You must be able to participate in the entire program. Among other eligibility requirements, applicants to the MARC-WSU program must be planning to earn a doctoral degree focused on biomedical research in the sciences or engineering.

Additional note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this application form so we can provide you with further assistance.

fields.label: Do you have a WSU ID#?

fields.label: Demographics Section Eligibility Reminder
fields.content:
*Important note: The MARC-WSU program is still awaiting a Notice of Award (NoA) from the NIH. Applicants to the program will only be officially accepted pending funding from NIH.

Reminder: The MARC-WSU program will begin the week prior to classes starting in the fall semester and continue for two academic years. The program includes the summer between your third and final semester. You must be able to participate in the entire program. Among other eligibility requirements, applicants to the MARC-WSU program must be planning to earn a doctoral degree focused on biomedical research in the sciences or engineering.

Additional note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this application form so we can provide you with further assistance.

fields.label: More about demographics and eligibility
fields.content: The goal of the MARC program is to increase the number of students who are traditionally underrepresented in STEM careers that emphasize biomedical research. Students participating in the program must meet at least one of three eligibility requirements that involve either belonging to certain racial and ethnic groups, having a disability, or coming from a disadvantaged background.

fields.label: Activities & Experiences Section Eligibility Reminder
fields.content:
*Important note: The MARC-WSU program is still awaiting a Notice of Award (NoA) from the NIH. Applicants to the program will only be officially accepted pending funding from NIH.

Reminder: The MARC-WSU program will begin the week prior to classes starting in the fall semester and continue for two academic years. The program includes the summer between your third and final semester. You must be able to participate in the entire program. Among other eligibility requirements, applicants to the MARC-WSU program must be planning to earn a doctoral degree focused on biomedical research in the sciences or engineering.

Additional note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this application form so we can provide you with further assistance.

fields.label: Intructions for Uploading CV
fields.content:
Please upload a CV that covers the activities and experiences you have gained which are relevant to the MARC program. When preparing your CV, please follow these guidelines:

  • Please list any jobs that you have held. Limit your list to no more than 4 of your most relevant jobs.
  • Please list any research experience you may have had. You may include high school research experiences but limit your list to no more than 6 research experiences. Include the time frame during which your experience took place and your specific role in the project.
  • Please list any Honors and Awards, limiting your list to your 6 most relevant honors or awards.
  • Please list any presentations or publications.
  • Please list no more than 6 recent activities or leadership experiences you have had.

fields.label: Goals & Interests Section Eligibility Reminder
fields.content:
*Important note: The MARC-WSU program is still awaiting a Notice of Award (NoA) from the NIH. Applicants to the program will only be officially accepted pending funding from NIH.

Reminder: The MARC-WSU program will begin the week prior to classes starting in the fall semester and continue for two academic years. The program includes the summer between your third and final semester. You must be able to participate in the entire program. Among other eligibility requirements, applicants to the MARC-WSU program must be planning to earn a doctoral degree focused on biomedical research in the sciences or engineering.

Additional note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this application form so we can provide you with further assistance.

fields.label: Please provide a personal statement.
fields.description:
Your personal statement should be up to 1700 words in length. Please include information about the following:
  • Why are you interested in a graduate degree in biomedical research?
  • How will the MARC-WSU program help you achieve your aspirations?
  • What barriers have you encountered in your life and if so, how have you overcome them (educational, personal, social, cultural, etc.)?
  • What area of research are you interested in?
  • What are your career goals?
  • What other information would you like to share about yourself?

fields.label: Transcripts and Recommendations Reminder
fields.content:
Reminder: The MARC-WSU program will begin the week prior to classes starting in the fall semester and continue for two academic years. The program includes the summer between your third and final semester. You must be able to participate in the entire program. Among other eligibility requirements, applicants to the MARC-WSU program must be planning to earn a doctoral degree focused on biomedical research in the sciences or engineering.

Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this application form so we can provide you with further assistance.

fields.label: Instructions for Emailing Transcripts
fields.content:
Transcripts

After submitting this application, you will need to send us transcripts from all post-secondary institutions that you attended. Transcripts should be emailed to WSU.MARC@wsu.edu and the subject line of the email should say YOUR NAME_Transcript.

To help us know what transcript we should expect to receive from you, we ask you to indicate below for which post-secondary institutions you will be sending transcripts .

fields.label: Transcripts and LOR Separator 1
fields.content: <hr class="mb--0mx mt--1500mx w--75pct">

fields.label: I will be emailing transcripts to the MARC-WSU program from the following post-secondary institutions:
fields.description: Please list one post-secondary institution per row. Use the plus button at the right of each row to add additional rows.

fields.label: Transcripts and LOR Separator 2
fields.content: <hr class="mb--0mx mt--1500mx w--75pct">

fields.label: Instructions for Emailing Recommendations
fields.content:
Letters of Recommendation

Request two letters of recommendation to be submitted by the deadline. The letters of recommendation must be from faculty who either taught, mentored, or advised you and should address your suitability for a future career in the biomedical sciences. The letters of recommendation should be sent to WSU.MARC@wsu.edu and the subject line of the email should say STUDENT NAME_recommendation (i.e., ask the faculty member to use your name in the subject line).

To help us know what letters of recommendation we should expect to receive from the two faculty who will be supporting your application, we ask you to provide their contact information. When you submit this form, we will send them an automated notification to provide them with a reminder about these instructions. However, we still encourage you to also contact the faculty and explain what to do in your own words.

fields.label: Transcripts and LOR Separator 3
fields.content: <hr class="mb--0mx mt--1500mx w--75pct">

fields.label: Name of first faculty member providing a letter of recommendation
Transcripts and LOR Separator 4
fields.content: <hr class="mb--0mx mt--1500mx w--75pct">

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Application Submitted

Thank you for applying to the MARC-WSU Program. The committee will begin reviewing applications in April. In the meantime, if you have any questions we are happy to answer them.

Mary Sánchez Lanier, Ph.D.
Assistant Vice Provost
wsu.marc@wsu.edu

Copy of Your Submission

notifications.name: To student: Application received
notifications.subject: MARC-WSU application received
notifications.message:
Dear {Name (First):4.3},

We are delighted to receive your application to the MARC-WSU program at Washington State University. The committee will begin reviewing applications in April. In the meantime, if you have any questions we are happy to answer them.

All the best,

Mary Sánchez Lanier, Ph.D.
Assistant Vice Provost
 
School of Molecular Biosciences
PO Box 647520
Washington State University
Pullman, WA. 99164-7520

notifications.name: To Recommender 1: Letter of Recommendation Request
notifications.subject: {Name (First):4.3} {Name (Last):4.6} has applied to the MARC-WSU program and needs you to submit a letter of recommendation
notifications.message:
Dear {Recommender 1 Name (First):54.3},

An undergraduate student at WSU, {Name (First):4.3} {Name (Last):4.6}, has just submitted an application to join the MARC — WSU program. We require each applicant to also request letters of recommendation from two faculty members who either taught, mentored, or advised them and can address their suitability for a future career in the biomedical sciences. {Name (First):4.3} listed you in their application as one of these faculty members who will provide such a letter.

We expect that {Name (First):4.3} has contacted or will contact you to request this letter of recommendation and provide further details. If you have not yet submitted a letter, we want to mention some important instructions. Letters of recommendation should be sent to WSU.MARC@wsu.edu and the subject line of the email should say STUDENT NAME_Recommendation. Also, if you have any questions we are happy to answer them.

Because this email was automatically generated when {Name (First):4.3} submitted their application, it is also possible that your letter of recommendation was already submitted, in which case we thank you for your submission.

All the best,

Mary Sánchez Lanier, Ph.D.
Assistant Vice Provost
 
School of Molecular Biosciences
PO Box 647520
Washington State University
Pullman, WA. 99164-7520
